sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4, 5}. Find (A × B) △ B and (B × A) △ B, where △ is the symmetric difference operator. Show that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
